clinical_study.brief_title: Lateral Wedge Insole With Subtalar Strapping for Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Lateral Wedge Insole With Subtalar Strapping for Knee Osteoarthritis: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This is a clinical study to evaluate the efficacy of a lateral wedge insole with subtalar strapping in knee osteoarthritis treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of a lateral wedge insole with subtalar strapping in knee osteoarthritis treatment. Fifty-eight patients with knee osteoarthritis were randomized to use either a lateral wedge or a neutral insole. VAS, Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) and Lequesne questionnaires were applied at baseline, and weeks two, eight, and 24.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of patient's symptoms using WOMAC (western ontario and mcmaster universities osteoarthritis index), VAS (visual analogic scale of pain) and Lequesne questionaires

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients that reported ankle pain related to the use of the insole as a measure of tolerability

arm_group.description: Lateral wedge insole with subtalar strapping Use of lateral wedge insoles with subtalar strapping for 5 to 10 hours daily
Neutral insole with subtalar strapping (sham) Use of neutral insoles with subtalar strapping for 5 to 10 hours daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet the American College of Rheumatology criteria for knee Osteoarthritis
- Varus malalignment of the knee
- Absence of previous fracture on the index knee
- Absence of previous surgery on the index knee
- Absence of Rheumatoid Arthritis
- No Intra-articular injection on the index knee in the past 6 months
- Receiving usual care for Osteoarthritis for at least 6 months
- Be able to understand and agree with the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Undergo surgery during the study
- Undergo Intra-articular injection during the study
- Develop articular infection of the index joint during the study
